title: Requirements Gathering and Analysis
description: Gather and analyze requirements for the distributed search engine, considering scalability, performance, reliability, and user experience.

title: Design Architecture and Data Model
description: Design the architecture of the distributed search engine, including data models for indexing and searching documents.

title: Develop Server-Side Components
description: Implement the backend components of the search engine, including indexing, query processing, and distributed communication.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Design and implement the frontend interface for the search engine, ensuring a user-friendly experience.

title: Database Design and Optimization
description: Design and optimize the database schema for efficient indexing, searching, and data storage.

title: Implement DevOps Pipeline
description: Create and configure the continuous integration/continuous deployment pipeline for building, testing, and deploying the search engine.

title: Security Review and Implementation
description: Review the design and implementation for potential security vulnerabilities, and implement necessary measures to protect user data.

title: Performance Testing and Optimization
description: Test the search engine's performance under various loads and optimize it for scalability.

title: Documentation and Knowledge Sharing
description: Write clear, comprehensive documentation for the search engine that includes architecture, usage, and setup guides. The documentation should be easy to understand and accessible to both developers and non-developers. Collaborate with team members from various roles (code-architect, frontend-developer, backend-developer, database-specialist, devops-engineer, qa-tester, security-specialist) to ensure all aspects of the project are covered. To keep the documentation up-to-date with the latest developments in the project, it's important to regularly review and update it as needed. Additionally, consider organizing the documentation into sections (e.g., technical architecture, installation guide, usage guide) for easier navigation.
